translations: n.（对权威、规定、法律的）反抗，违抗；叛乱，造反
v.叛乱，造反；反抗，拒绝服从（权威、规定或法律）；使反感，使震惊

sentences.sentence: In February 1848, the people of Paris rose in revolt against the constitutional monarchy of Louis-Philippe.
sentences.translation: 1848年2月，巴黎人民奋起反抗路易-菲利浦君主立宪制。

sentences.sentence: If instead we regard the financing of warfare by taxation in this period as a background condition, then we will see the English reverse themselves as the main cause of the revolt.
sentences.translation: 如果我们将这一时期的通过税收来支持军事作为背景条件，那么我们就会看到英国人自己的失败反倒是造成反抗的主要原因。
